title.value: Stateful Active Facilitator: Coordination and Environmental Heterogeneity in Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as mentioned at the beginning and throughout the text.
title.quote: STATEFUL ACTIVE FACILITATOR: COORDINATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL HETEROGENEITY IN COOPERATIVE MULTI-AGENT REINFORCEMENT LEARNING

extractions.description: The paper addresses the varying degrees of coordination and environmental heterogeneity in cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL). It introduces HECOGrid, a suite of environments designed to empirically evaluate MARL approaches with quantitative control over coordination and heterogeneity levels. The paper also proposes the Stateful Active Facilitator (SAF), a learning approach that leverages centralized training and decentralized execution to improve performance in complex environments. The performance of SAF is compared with IPPO and MAPPO.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical evaluations of the proposed approaches against existing models using the HECOGrid environments.
type.quote: Further, we propose a Centralized Training Decentralized Execution learning approach called Stateful Active Facilitator (SAF) that enables agents to work efficiently in high-coordination and high-heterogeneity environments through a differentiable and shared knowledge source used during training and dynamic selection from a shared pool of policies. We evaluate SAF and compare its performance against baselines IPPO and MAPPO on HECOGrid.

name.justification: The paper focuses on reinforcement learning in a multi-agent setting.
name.quote: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) studies the problem of sequential decision-making in an environment with multiple actors.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with cooperative strategies in multi-agent environments.
name.quote: In cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning, a team of agents works together to achieve a common goal.

name.justification: This is the primary model proposed by the authors.
name.quote: we propose a Centralized Training Decentralized Execution learning approach called Stateful Active Facilitator (SAF).

is_contributed.justification: Stateful Active Facilitator (SAF) is introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose a Centralized Training Decentralized Execution learning approach called Stateful Active Facilitator (SAF).

is_executed.justification: The paper states that the model was deployed for evaluation.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate SAF and compare its performance against baselines IPPO and MAPPO on HECOGrid.

is_compared.justification: SAF is numerically compared to IPPO and MAPPO.
is_compared.quote: Our results show that SAF consistently outperforms the baselines across different tasks and different heterogeneity and coordination levels.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no reference to a previous paper specifically for SAF as it is a new contribution.

name.justification: IPPO is used as a baseline for comparison.

referenced_paper_title.value: Is Independent Learning All You Need in the StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenge?
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced for IPPO.
referenced_paper_title.quote: de Witt et al. (2020) recently showed that PPO, when used for independent learning in multi-agent settings (called Independent PPO or IPPO) is in fact capable of beating several state-of-the-art approaches in MARL on competitive benchmarks such as StarCraft (Samvelyan et al., 2019).

name.justification: MAPPO is used as a baseline for comparison.
name.quote: Centralized Training Decentralized Execution (CTDE) such as MADDPG (Lowe et al., 2017), MAPPO (Yu et al., 2021), HAPPO and HTRPO (Kuba et al., 2021) was developed.

is_contributed.justification: MAPPO is not a new model introduced by the paper.

referenced_paper_title.value: The Surprising Effectiveness of PPO in Cooperative Multi-Agent Games
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced for MAPPO.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Yu et al. (2021) proposes the extension PPO (Schulman et al., 2017) to a multi-agent framework in a similar manner.

name.justification: HECOGrid is introduced in the paper for evaluating MARL approaches.
name.quote: We formalize the notions of coordination level and heterogeneity level of an environment and present HECOGrid, a suite of multi-agent RL environments that facilitates empirical evaluation of different MARL approaches across different levels of coordination and environmental heterogeneity.

referenced_paper_title.justification: HECOGrid is introduced in this paper and is not referenced from another work.
